what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal bbsTaiwan streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) data retrieval analysis. support data retrieval GBIF, Taiwan BBS data stored. ‘bbsTrim’ also include population trend modelling. Users can tailor species analysis, controlling data stratification, preparation, modeling. goal expand Taiwan BBS data access broader R-society Taiwan.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install load development version bbsTaiwan GitHub :

what: If you need raw Taiwan BBS dataset on GBIF:
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Taiwan BBS raw data can accessed directly typing object name: complete Taiwan BBS dataset GBIF following Darwin Core Archive (DwC - ) format: Occurrence: lists set times locations particular species recorded Event: lists includes protocols used, sample size, location Measurement Facts: includes additional information relating events Extended Measurement Fact: includes additional information relating taxon occurrences

what: bbsTaiwan also provide a workflow to process Taiwan BBS data:
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows use package: Check distribution BBS sites number sites surveyed throughout years:   Check sites surveyed Look scientific name species interest Fetch data species interest. need dataset across species, leave argument target_species NULL. output bbs_fetch list two elements: occurrence site_info. occurrence tibble, showing observations target species within selected year range function bbs_fetch can also take multiple species time: View distribution occurrence target species within selected year range
code: bbs_history(type = "plot") bbs_history(type = "table") #> # A tibble: 8 × 6 #>   year   East Mountain North  West Others #>   <chr> <int>    <int> <int> <int>  <int> #> 1 2009     31       41    24    52      0 #> 2 2010     30       26    25    57      2 #> 3 2011     24       37    55   134      3 #> 4 2012     31       47    88   142      3 #> 5 2013     28       43    80   138      2 #> 6 2014     36       46    91   118      2 #> 7 2015     36       49   112   143     12 #> 8 2016     38       42    98   157      2 bbs_plotmap(NULL) bbs_sites() #> # A tibble: 4,160 × 20 #>    id      eventID parentEventID samplingProtocol sampleSizeValue sampleSizeUnit #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>         <chr>                      <dbl> <chr>          #>  1 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #>  2 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #>  3 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #>  4 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #>  5 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #>  6 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #>  7 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #>  8 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #>  9 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #> 10 TWBBS_… TWBBS_… TWBBS_2009_A… Point count               31416. square metre   #> # ℹ 4,150 more rows #> # ℹ 14 more variables: samplingEffort <chr>, eventDate <date>, eventTime <chr>, #> #   locationID <chr>, country <chr>, countryCode <chr>, locality <chr>, #> #   decimalLatitude <dbl>, decimalLongitude <dbl>, geodeticDatum <chr>, #> #   coordinateUncertaintyInMeters <dbl>, coordinatePrecision <dbl>, site <chr>, #> #   plot <chr> bbs_translate(c("白頭翁", "烏頭翁", "台灣噪眉")) #> [1] "Pycnonotus sinensis"          "Pycnonotus taivanus"          #> [3] "Trochalopteron morrisonianum" x <- bbs_fetch(target_species = bbs_translate("火冠戴菊鳥")) x #> # A tibble: 36,385 × 16 #>     year month   day site   locationID decimalLatitude decimalLongitude weather #>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl> <chr>   #>  1  2009     4    19 B14-01 B14-01_10             24.4             121. <NA>    #>  2  2009     6     7 B13-01 B13-01_06             24.5             121. <NA>    #>  3  2009     6    25 B13-01 B13-01_06             24.5             121. <NA>    #>  4  2009     5    26 B13-01 B13-01_05             24.5             121. <NA>    #>  5  2009     6     7 B13-01 B13-01_05             24.5             121. <NA>    #>  6  2009     5    26 B13-01 B13-01_03             24.5             121. <NA>    #>  7  2009     6     7 B13-01 B13-01_03             24.5             121. <NA>    #>  8  2009     6    25 B13-01 B13-01_01             24.5             121. <NA>    #>  9  2009     6     7 B13-01 B13-01_07             24.5             121. <NA>    #> 10  2009     5    29 B13-01 B13-01_08             24.5             121. <NA>    #> # ℹ 36,375 more rows #> # ℹ 8 more variables: wind <chr>, habitat <chr>, scientificName <chr>, #> #   vernacularName <chr>, individualCount <dbl>, time_slot <chr>, #> #   distance <chr>, flock <chr> x <- bbs_fetch(bbs_translate(c("烏頭翁", "白頭翁"))) bbs_plotmap(bbs_translate(c("烏頭翁", "白頭翁")))

what: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
title: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
text: function fetches occurrence data specified target species, utilizing event occurrence tables GBIF. fetched dataset undergoes following processing steps compared raw dataset: Retains observations specified target species. Converts implicit missing values explicit ones (e.g., filling zeros trips target species observed). Specifically, site/plot visited specific year/trip, without observing target species, dataset value 0 row.

title: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
text: target_species Character string specifying scientific name species interest. can accept single character string, target_species = "Hypsipetes leucocephalus", vector, target_species = c("Hypsipetes leucocephalus", "Heterophasia auricularis"). Leave undefined use NULL return species. Use bbs_translate function help find species' scientific names.

title: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
text: tibble containing species occurrence data.

title: Fetch BBS Occurrence Data by Species — bbs_fetch
code: bbs_fetch(target_species = c("Pycnonotus taivanus", "Pycnonotus sinensis")) #> ! The bird is not in the BBS species list #> ! 查無鳥名 #> ! The bird is not in the BBS species list #> ! 查無鳥名 #> NULL

what: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
title: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
text: function returns number sites surveyed year BBS Taiwan project. Sites mapped five regions: East, West, South, North, Mountain (elevation higher 1,000 m).

title: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
text: type Character string specifying output format: either "table" "plot". Default value type = "plot"

title: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history
text: tibble ggplot showing number sites surveyed year across regions.

title: Examine the Number of BBS Sites Surveyed Each Year — bbs_history

what: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
title: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
text: function visualizes sites surveyed breeding birds Taiwan, highlighting presence absence specific species. designed upon function bbs_fetch.

title: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
text: target_species Character string specifying scientific name species interest. can accept single character string, target_species = "Hypsipetes leucocephalus", vector, target_species = c("Hypsipetes leucocephalus", "Heterophasia auricularis"). Leave undefined use NULL return species. Use bbs_translate function help find species' scientific names.

title: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
text: ggplot object showing distribution map.

title: Visualize Species Distribution Across All BBS Sites — bbs_plotmap
code: bbs_plotmap(target_species = c("Pycnonotus taivanus", "Pycnonotus sinensis")) #> ! The bird is not in the BBS species list #> ! 查無鳥名 #> ! The bird is not in the BBS species list #> ! 查無鳥名 #> NULL

what: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
title: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
text: function returns coordinates BBS sites surveyed. arguments needed. coordinates reported using WGS84 projection system. Use terra::vect(geom = c("decimalLatitude", "decimalLongitude"), crs = "epsg:4326") transform table spatial object.

title: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
text: tibble including coordinates BBS survey sites, WGS84.

title: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites
text: source data comes event table GBIF dataset.

title: Return the Coordinates of All BBS Sites — bbs_sites

what: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
title: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
text: function intended use bbs_fetch function, requires target_species argument scientific names. function helps users find scientific names birds Chinese common names species found Taiwan.

title: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
text: target_species single character string vector character strings representing species' names Chinese.

title: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
text: vector bird species' scientific names. input species name included bird list Taiwan, "bird BBS list" returned. Please check typos.

title: Translate Bird Species' Chinese Common Name to Scientific Name — bbs_translate
code: # For a single species bbs_translate("白頭翁") #> [1] "Pycnonotus sinensis"  # For multiple species bbs_translate(target_species = c("烏頭翁", "白頭翁")) #> [1] "Pycnonotus taivanus" "Pycnonotus sinensis"
